results.title: The Banjo and the bard
results.brief_description: A poetic debate between Banjo Paterson and Henry Lawson ran over several weeks in the Bulletin magazine of the 1890s. The subject of the debate was the Australian bush. Paterson, who spent most of his life in more affluent surroundings than Lawson, saw the bush as a place of romance and adventure. Lawson saw only the hardship and struggle. To earn themselves some money they convinced the Bulletin to print the poems they each wrote disclaiming the other’s point-of-view. The story is filmed entirely in contemporary settings with Paterson and Lawson, in their period costume, as the only references to the time-frame of the Bulletin articles.

results.title: The Band Wagon
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Arthur Freed and Vincente Minnelli
results.brief_description: A has-been Hollywood dancer joins forces with a temperamental stage producer to put on a Broadway musical. “The Band Wagon” has a witty, original screenplay, with some of the most exciting musical numbers ever put on film. Stars Fred Astaire and Cyd Charisse with Jack Buchanan, Oscar Levant and Nanette Fabray.

results.title: The Band concert
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Despite interference from a bee, a noisy Donald Duck playing “Turkey in the Straw”, and a full scale whirlwind, Mickey’s band doggedly performs the “William Tell Overture”. This was the first Mickey Mouse cartoon to use technicolor and is considered to be one of the Disney studios best.

results.title: The Band
results.creator_credit: Isis Productions, Daniel Television, This Band, Caroline Thomas and Bob Smeaton
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
The Band- comprising Rick Danko, Levon Helm, Garth Hudson, Richard Manuel and Robbie Robertson where initially known for supporting Bob Dylan on tour but they quickly became known as a band, The Band, within their own right. After signing with Capitol Records in 1968, they recorded eight U.S. Top 40 albums, including three million sellers. Out of all of the group’s albums, their eponymously titled 1969 album achieved Billboard success, was their second million seller, and is now regarded as a rock classic because of its careful blending of black, country, rockabilly and rock and roll music. The story of The Band and their classic album is recounted here in words, images and music, with contributions by rock legends Eric Clapton, George Harrison, Bernie Taupin and Don Was. Band members too offer an insight into the creative processes at work behind their albums that were universally popular.

results.title: The Banana story
results.creator_credit: Australia Health Publicity Control Council, Cambridge Film Productions and David Bilcock
results.brief_description: An account of the banana growing industry in northern New South Wales, showing all stages in the growing of bananas; areas of Queensland and New South Wales most suited to banana growing; tree felling and clearing the land; preparation of the ground; planting; pest and disease control; development of the fruit on the plant; picking, grading, packing and transporting the fruit to all states; finally ripening the fruit prior to sale at local markets.

results.title: The Banana splits and friends show
results.creator_credit: Hanna-Barbera Productions, Turner Broadcasting System and Edward Rosen
results.brief_description: Rev up your dune buggies and return to the Banana Pad for one last stand with the crazy Banana Splits - Fleegle, Bingo, Drooper and Snorky! Experience the first three episodes of this groovy 1960s children’s entertainment show. Tune in for your fix of psychedelic performance clips from the Splits and get the vibes from the original cartoons - “The Arabian Knights”, “The Three Musketeers” and the live-action “Danger Island” starring Jan-Michael Vincent. Far out!

results.title: The Bamboo Curtain Falls
results.brief_description: This is the second part of a two part documentary that looks at the mysterious story of Tibet. It is the story about a country unseen by Europeans until early this century, of its destruction by invading Chinese in 1950, and the flight into India of the Dalai Lama with 100,000 Tibetans.

results.title: The Bamboo brush (K)
results.creator_credit: Seaton McLean, Michael Macmillan, Janice Platt and Sturla Gunnarsson
results.brief_description: This is a story about a young Chinese-American boy, living in America, and the conflicts that he encounters as a result of the two very different cultures that he is part of. Through his troubles, the boy becomes very close to his Chinese grandfather and after the grandfather’s death, he realises that he has resolved his conflicts.

results.title: The Baltimore plan
results.brief_description: Explains how a young social worker aroused the interest of citizens, government officials, and a local newspaper in the housing conditions in Baltimore’s slums. Describes the “Baltimore Plan” which made minimum housing standards a legal requirement and which created a Housing Court to enforce the laws. Shows how officials and citizens in Baltimore attacked the problem in selected areas. No other credits available.

results.title: The Baltic story
results.creator_credit: Gordon Bradley Ltd and Gordon Bradley
results.brief_description: Produced for the Baltimore Mercantile and Shipping Exchange, this film describes the world-wide activities of the Baltic Exchange. This is the international centre for the chartering of ships and aircraft - a vast clearing house where carriers are found for cargo and cargo for carriers - to and from any port in the world. The Baltic has the distinction of being the world’s only shipping exchange. Narrated by John Le Mesurier the film features the work of a broker, John Hall, during a day at the exchange.
